item.title: Blockchain Makes Microfinance Accounting Foray in Burma Led by Infoteria and Tech Bureau of Japan
item.description:
Blockchain Makes Microfinance Accounting Foray in Burma Led by Infoteria and Tech Bureau of Japan

Developing countries present a huge opportunity which is hidden under veil of a problem in the form of the underbanked. Burma is one such emerging economy. In such countries providing banking services to those who have been the most ignored by mainstream economy can bring about significant benefits.

item.title: Peter Todd Urges Boycott of Bitcoin 'Deterioration' Proposal BIP75
item.description:
Peter Todd Urges Boycott of Bitcoin 'Deterioration' Proposal BIP75

Both Peter Todd and Andreas Antonopoulos have voiced their distaste for the latest Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP75)'s know-your-customer (KYC) and anti-money laundering (AML) aspects. Also read: 'As If Identity Was the Goal': Antonopoulos Slams Blockchain KYC The update, known as BIP75 and co-authored by developers from Netki and Breadwallet, allows for transactions to be more compliant with many countries' payment legislation.

item.title: Bitcoin Impact Unclear as Chinese Legislators Draft 'Virtual Property' Law - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Impact Unclear as Chinese Legislators Draft 'Virtual Property' Law - CoinDesk

The National People's Congress, the national legislature of China, has released draft text for a civil law code that, if implemented, would provide a legal definition for virtual property. Following the announcement yesterday, reports began emerging that the definition could extend to blockchain-based assets including bitcoin and other digital currencies, with such speculation being set off by communications from ChinaLedger, a China-based blockchain consortium.

item.title: Indian Bank ICICI Establishes Digital Division to Harness Blockchain Technology
item.description:
Indian Bank ICICI Establishes Digital Division to Harness Blockchain Technology

ICICI Bank in India has created a chief technology and digital officer position (CTDO) along with a technology and digital group (TDG) to work on improving the bank's digital capabilities, Chanda Kochhar, managing director and CEO noted in an interview, according to Mint, an Indian business publication.

item.title: Is worth doing PhD in blockchains and cryptocurrencies?
item.description:
Is worth doing PhD in blockchains and cryptocurrencies?

Answer (1 of 3): I think in general a Phd servers many purposes other than just making you a master of one narrowed down field. 1. Research Skills : It teaches you how to do research, how to read papers, find a new area to research, how to find new things in that area.

item.title: Deutsche Bank Wary About DAO Incident, Continues to Explore Blockchain
item.description:
Deutsche Bank Wary About DAO Incident, Continues to Explore Blockchain

Deutsche Bank sees The DAO incident as a timely reminder of the importance of testing products before they are unleashed. In 2014 Deutsche Bank launched a series of innovation labs in collaboration with IBM, Microsoft and the Indian outsourcing company HCL. The aim was to improve the bank's digital banking services.

item.title: This New Tech Turns a Bitcoin and Ethereum Wallet into a Contactless Card
item.description:
This New Tech Turns a Bitcoin and Ethereum Wallet into a Contactless Card

Plutus, a new start-up based in London, allows any merchant with contactless card terminals to accept bitcoin and ethereum payments regardless of whether the merchant has in fact adopted bitcoin or ethereum.

item.title: SatoshiLabs Partners with Tech Bureau Bringing Trezor to Japan
item.description:
SatoshiLabs Partners with Tech Bureau Bringing Trezor to Japan

Fintech company Also read: Russian Prime Minister: DAO's an 'Interesting Challenge' for Lawmakers Tech Bureau, located in Osaka, Japan, announced that its subsidiary, bitcoin exchange Zaif, has partnered with SatoshiLabs to help distribute the Trezor Wallet across the Japanese region. Since Spring 2016, Japanese Bitcoin enthusiasm has significantly increased, according to Tech Bureau.

item.title: Is CoinDesk the major publication with regard to Bitcoin and Blockchain?
item.description:
Is CoinDesk the major publication with regard to Bitcoin and Blockchain?

It leads to an interesting conversation: Obama: Hello Judge/Professor Smith, how are you today? Smith: Fine, thank you. What can I do for you, Mr. President? Obama: As you heard, I'm looking to fill a vacancy on the Supreme Court. I'll be honest with you, the Republicans have already said that they won't bring this to a vote.

item.title: Australian bitcoin auction nets $22m
item.description:
Australian bitcoin auction nets $22m

Ernst and Young transactions partner Adam Nikitins said multiple bidders claimed 24,518 units of the digital currency during the auction, which was only the second-ever globally, between June 20-21. The auction was held last week and E&Y announced the result on Tuesday.
